transparency_law.name: New Jersey Open Public Records Act (OPRA)

response_requirements.initial_response_description: 7 business days for standard requests; 14 business days for commercial use requests (as of 2024 amendments)

fee_structure.search_fee: May charge for special service for large requests
fee_structure.copy_fee_notes: First 10 pages free; additional pages at actual cost of duplication

appeal_process.first_level_deadline_notes: Must file GRC complaint within 45 days of denial
appeal_process.attorney_fees_notes: Under 2024 amendments, only if agency unreasonably denied access, acted in bad faith, or knowingly violated OPRA

requester_requirements.identification_notes: Must provide name, address, and telephone number
requester_requirements.purpose_notes: Must state purpose; must certify whether connected to legal proceeding (2024 amendment)
requester_requirements.specific_format: Requests for emails must include discrete time period, specific subject matter, and employee names/titles (2024 amendment)

agency_obligations.redaction_requirements: Must redact personal information per Daniel's Law and 2024 amendments
agency_obligations.website_posting_required: Must post records on publicly available website to the extent feasible (2024 amendment)

oversight_body.name: Government Records Council (GRC)
oversight_body.contact_info: 101 South Broad Street, PO Box 819, Trenton, NJ 08625-0819

validation_metadata.verification_notes: All fields verified from official New Jersey statute. Major 2024 amendments effective September 3, 2024. 7 business day response for standard requests, 14 days for commercial. First 10 pages free. Government Records Council provides oversight.
unique_characteristics: Enhanced specificity requirements for email requests
Modified attorney fees standard (harder to recover)
